title: Job Openings at Simba Group
content:
The Simba Group which started operations in 1988, is a conglomerate having a Pan-Nigeria presence and business interests in some other most dynamic sectors in the economy. The Group is a dominant player in the transportation, power products, and IT-enabled service sectors which are critical to the sustained growth of the Nigerian Economy. The corporate vision of the Group is to provide innovative and quality products along with excellent aftersales service to our customers. The activities of the Group are guided by strong value systems built around Integrity, Innovation, Openness, and Consistency.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Institutional Marketing Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Ogba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Institutional Marketing Manager will lead the expansion of the company's institutional market footprint in Nigeria.
	This strategic role involves developing and implementing comprehensive B2B marketing initiatives, from identifying high-value prospects and optimizing outreach to creating impactful marketing assets that enable the Institutional Sales team and elevate brand authority among decision-makers and target audience.


Key Responsibilities
Market Research & Prospecting:


	Conduct in-depth research into target verticals, including Government agencies, Corporate institutions (FMCG, Gas/Cylinder companies, food, Logistics/Courier etc) food companies, banks and Multi-National Corporations.
	Develop and manage a robust pipeline of qualified prospects, aligning with Sales using proven channels such as LinkedIn, industry directories, government tender portals etc.


Outreach Strategy & Execution:


	Design and oversee data-driven, multi-channel outreach campaigns (email, LinkedIn, phone etc)
	Refine messaging to resonate with target audience while collaborating with Sales for alignment.
	Establish clear metrics for outreach success and report on campaign performance.


Marketing Asset Development & Management:


	Oversee the creation and refinement of marketing and sales support materials, including compelling email sequences, bespoke proposals, product brochures, and other essential collaterals.
	Work closely with Sales and technical teams to ensure marketing assets accurately reflect product capabilities and address client needs.


Brand Awareness & Thought Leadership:


	Drive initiatives to increase brand awareness and establish thought leadership within institutional segments.
	Develop visibility of the brand in high-value channels and formats (webinars, conferences etc.) and cultivate strong media and organisational relationships.
	Implement targeted digital marketing (LinkedIn Ads, Google Ads) and explore strategic partnerships.


Qualifications


	Minimum of Bachelor's degree, preferably in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
	3-5 years of experience in B2B marketing, institutional sales support, or business development, preferably within the automotive, logistics, or industrial sectors.
	Strong research, analytical, and communication skills (written and verbal).
	Familiarity with the Nigerian business landscape and government procurement processes is a plus.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, target-driven environment.


Application Closing Date: 29th July, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Automobile Fabrication Manager - 3W Product

Job Location: Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Manufacturing / Operations
Reports To: Assembly Manager
Industry: Automotive (Three-Wheelers – Passenger & Cargo)

Job Summary


	We are seeking a highly experienced and process-driven Automobile Fabrication Manager to lead the end-to-end fabrication and body-building operations for our Three-Wheeler (3W) product line.
	The ideal candidate will have a solid background in automotive fabrication, sheet metal forming, welding processes, and jig & fixture design, ensuring high-quality output through strong leadership, planning, and process optimization.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage complete fabrication operations for 3W product chassis and body systems including frame welding, forming, trimming, and sub-assembly integration.
	Lead a team of fabrication technicians and supervisors ensuring productivity, quality, and safety targets.
	Coordinate with Design, R&D, Quality, and Production Planning to ensure DFM (Design for Manufacturing) practices and timelines are met.
	Oversee tooling development – including jigs, fixtures, and dies for welding and assembly operations.
	Maintain and optimize welding procedures (MIG/TIG/Spot), CNC cutting, and bending processes.
	Monitor fabrication KPIs – yield, cycle time, rework %, and lead-time – and drive continuous improvement (Kaizen, Lean, Six Sigma).
	Implement and ensure compliance with ISO/TS 16949, IATF 16949, or similar quality systems within the fabrication shop.
	Drive adherence to health, safety, and environmental standards as per industry norms.
	Conduct regular training and upskilling programs for technicians and operators.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree/Diploma in Mechanical/Automobile Engineering or related discipline.
	6–10 years of relevant experience in fabrication & body shop operations, ideally in a 3-wheeler or light commercial vehicle segment.
	Strong technical knowledge of sheet metal fabrication, welding processes, robotic welding (preferred), and structural assembly.
	Experience with fabrication CAD tools (SolidWorks, AutoCAD) and familiarity with ERP and MES systems.
	Proven leadership, team management, and communication skills.
	Familiarity with quality assurance tools like FMEA, SPC, Root Cause Analysis (RCA), PPAP.


Preferred:


	Experience with 3-wheeler chassis or composite body manufacturing.
	Certifications in Welding Inspection, Lean Manufacturing, or Six Sigma (Green/Black Belt).
	Hands-on experience in setting up new fabrication lines or automation cells.


Application Closing Date: 24th July, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Production Manager - Assembly Plant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a results-driven and experienced Production Manager to lead our Assembly Plant operations, ensuring the timely, cost-effective, and high-quality output of finished goods.
	The ideal candidate will bring a strong background in assembly line setup, lean manufacturing, team leadership, and cross-functional coordination across a dynamic shop floor. Hands-on experience with vehicle assembly, battery integration, modular systems, or semi/fully automated lines will be highly advantageous.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, organize, and manage day-to-day operations of the assembly lines to meet production targets in terms of volume, quality, cost, and timelines.
	Monitor and control production schedules, resource allocation, takt time, and workflow balancing.
	Lead, train, and supervise assembly supervisors, line leaders, and technicians, fostering a culture of accountability and continuous improvement.
	Coordinate with Supply Chain, Quality, Maintenance, and Engineering teams for smooth execution of assembly operations.
	Analyze and optimize productivity metrics – OEE, downtime, cycle time, rejection %, and rework levels.
	Ensure strict adherence to safety, quality, and environmental standards (ISO 9001 / IATF 16949 / ISO 14001 / EHS protocols).
	Drive implementation of Lean tools (Kaizen, 5S, Kanban, TPM, SMED) and problem-solving frameworks (PDCA, RCA, FMEA).
	Manage material flow on the shop floor using Just-In-Time (JIT), pull systems, or digital assembly control systems.
	Support NPI (New Product Introduction) ramp-up, changeovers, and process validation at the assembly line.
	Report production performance to senior management and recommend improvements in plant operations and efficiency.
	Play a key role in integrating new technologies such as robotic or semi-automated systems, especially in vehicle or battery assembly lines, to enhance throughput and efficiency.


Required Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree or Diploma in Mechanical / Production / Industrial / Automobile Engineering.
	8–15 years of experience in assembly shop or manufacturing plant, preferably in automotive, EVs, or heavy equipment industries.
	Proven track record in managing production teams in high-speed, multi-model or variant assembly operations.
	Proficiency in using ERP/MES systems and MS Office tools for production monitoring and reporting.
	Strong knowledge of quality tools, lean manufacturing, and people management.


Preferred Skills & Experience (Strongly Considered):


	Experience with vehicle assembly, battery pack integration, or modular/semi-automated assembly systems.
	Familiarity with robotic automation and smart manufacturing technologies.
	Certifications in Lean Six Sigma, Total Productive Maintenance (TPM), or Industrial Safety.
	Demonstrated ability to lead high-performance teams in a technology-driven production environment.
	Strong leadership, communication, and analytical problem-solving skills.


Application Closing Date: 24th July, 2025.
